Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 1 Oct 2023 | Created 1 Feb 2011

This page has been accessed 6,212 times.

Biography

Grandfather of James Madison 4th President of the United States

Francis Conway, son of Edwin and Edwin's second wife, Elizabeth Thornton, was born in Richmond County, Virginia, about 1696-1698. He married Rebecca Catlett, daughter of Colonel John Catlett and Elizabeth Gaines of Essex County in 1717.

In 1727, Francis built home a home he called Mount Zion near in Port Conway, near Port Royal.[1] Francis Conway was appointed one of the Justices of Caroline County in 1728.

Francis and Rebecca's children were:[2]

Catlett, b. 11 Jan. 1719[3]

Francis II, b. 27 Dec. 1722, m. c. 1744 Sarah Taliaferro, d. 17 May 1761[4]

Elizabeth, b. 4 Jan. 1724, (m. James Taylor?)

Reuben, b. 10 Nov. 1725, d. 1745

Sarah, b. 27 Aug. 1728, (m. Dr. Charles Taylor?)

Eleanor Rose "Nellie," b. 9 Jan 1731, m. 15 (or 13) Sep. 1749 Col. James Madison, d. 11 Feb. 1829.[5]

Francis died 12 Apr 1733, at Caroline, Virginia or Port Conway, King George, Virginia.[6]

The unmarked site of the Conway house sits on the bluff above the present day James Madison Memorial Bridge that joins Port Royal and Port Conway. Francis' grandson, who would become President James Madison, was born in that house on March 16, 1751.[7]

From "The Broun Family and Their Kindred", an article in The Gulf States Historical Magazine, Volume 2, p. 408:

Edwin Conway [Francis' father], of the second generation, resided in Lancaster county, Va. He was born about 1640, and died in 1698. He was married twice: (1) To Sarah, daughter of Colonel John Walker, of Gloucester county, Va.; (2) To Elizabeth Thompson.

Issue by marriage to Sarah Walker:

(a) Edwin Conway.

(b) Mary Conway, born September 6, 1686, died 15th September, 1730. She married, first, John Dangerfield, November 11, 1703; second Major James Ball, April 16, 1707.

Issue by marriage to Elizabeth Thompson:

Francis Conway, born 1697; married in 1720 to Rebecca Catlett.

Edwin Conway, of the second generation, made a deed, May 10, 1695, conveying lands and other valuable property to his two children, Edwin and Mary, recorded in Lancaster county clerk's office, July 12, 1695.

Eleanor Rose Conway, daughter of Francis Conway and Rebecca Catlett, was born January 9, 1731, and married Colonel James Madison, Sr., September 13, 1749, and died February 11, 1829.

James Madison, President of the United States, was the son of Colonel James Madison, Sr., and his wife Eleanor Rose Conway.
